flawed_nl_solution:
The 6 T-shirts cost 6 x $8 = $<<6*8=48>>48.
The 4 sweaters cost 4 x $18 = $<<4*18=72>>72.
And 5 jackets normally cost 5 x $80 = $<<5*80=400>>400.
So, a discount of 1/10 x $400 = $<<1/10*400=40>>40 for the five jackets.
Thus, the selling price of the five jackets is $400 - $40 = $<<400-40=306>>306.
Hence, the total cost of all the items is $48 + $72 + $306 = $<<48+72+306=426>>426.
The sales tax is equal to 1/20 x $426 = $<<1/20*426=213/10>>213/10.
Therefore, Kevin has to pay $426 + $213/10 = $<<426+213/10=4473/10>>4473/10. including the sales tax.
